fields.description: After deregistering an image, and running (ec2 | euca)-delete-bundle successfully, if a user runs (ec2 | euca)-delete-bundle with the --clear option, we return the following error: {code} $ euca-delete-bundle -b imwitit -p raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img --clear --debug 2013-08-22 14:32:42,710 DEBUG DeleteBundle parsed arguments: {'userregion': None, 'url': None, 'clear': True, 'bucket': 'imwitit', 'prefix': 'raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img', 'delete_all': False, 'key_id': None, 'manifest_path': None, 'secret_key': None} 2013-08-22 14:32:42,710 DEBUG Config searching regions for option 's3-url' 2013-08-22 14:32:42,710 DEBUG Config section 'aws:us-east-1' 2013-08-22 14:32:42,710 INFO Config option 's3-url' = 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/' 2013-08-22 14:32:42,710 DEBUG Config searching regions for option 'verify-ssl' 2013-08-22 14:32:42,711 DEBUG Config section 'aws:us-east-1' 2013-08-22 14:32:42,711 DEBUG Config section 'aws:*' 2013-08-22 14:32:42,711 INFO Config option 'verify-ssl' = 'true' 2013-08-22 14:32:42,715 INFO Walrus sending request (attempt 1 of 3) 2013-08-22 14:32:42,716 DEBUG S3RestAuth canonicalized_headers: '' 2013-08-22 14:32:42,716 DEBUG S3RestAuth canonicalized resource: '/imwitit' 2013-08-22 14:32:42,716 DEBUG S3RestAuth string to sign: 'GET\n\n\nThu, 22 Aug 2013 21:32:42 -0000\n/imwitit' 2013-08-22 14:32:42,716 DEBUG S3RestAuth b64-encoded signature: So0N1yLwxZNS05QUabnwiIVlIhI= 2013-08-22 14:32:42,725 DEBUG Walrus request method: GET 2013-08-22 14:32:42,725 DEBUG Walrus request url: http://10.104.1.216:8773/services/Walrus/imwitit?max-keys=0 2013-08-22 14:32:42,725 DEBUG Walrus request header: Authorization: AWS L4836KVYWMJCXT4T6Q6B9:So0N1yLwxZNS05QUabnwiIVlIhI= 2013-08-22 14:32:42,725 DEBUG Walrus request header: Content-Length: 0 2013-08-22 14:32:42,725 DEBUG Walrus request header: Date: Thu, 22 Aug 2013 21:32:42 -0000 2013-08-22 14:32:42,725 DEBUG Walrus request header: Host: 10.104.1.216:8773 2013-08-22 14:32:42,725 DEBUG Walrus request header: User-Agent: euca2ools/3.0.0 (CPython 2.6.6; Linux 2.6.32-358.6.2.el6.x86_64; x86_64) requestbuilder/0.1.0-beta2 requests/1.1.0 2013-08-22 14:32:42,725 DEBUG Walrus request param: max-keys: 0 2013-08-22 14:32:42,801 DEBUG Walrus response time: 0.075 seconds 2013-08-22 14:32:42,801 INFO Walrus response status: 200 2013-08-22 14:32:42,801 DEBUG Walrus response header: content-length: 229 2013-08-22 14:32:42,801 DEBUG Walrus response header: content-type: application/xml 2013-08-22 14:32:42,804 INFO Walrus sending request (attempt 1 of 3) 2013-08-22 14:32:42,804 DEBUG S3RestAuth canonicalized_headers: '' 2013-08-22 14:32:42,804 DEBUG S3RestAuth canonicalized resource: '/imwitit/raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.manifest.xml' 2013-08-22 14:32:42,804 DEBUG S3RestAuth string to sign: 'GET\n\n\nThu, 22 Aug 2013 21:32:42 -0000\n/imwitit/raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.manifest.xml' 2013-08-22 14:32:42,805 DEBUG S3RestAuth b64-encoded signature: 1mGBhKR4G+vFv6QmL8XHHAV/UoM= 2013-08-22 14:32:42,805 DEBUG Walrus request method: GET 2013-08-22 14:32:42,805 DEBUG Walrus request url: http://10.104.1.216:8773/services/Walrus/imwitit/raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.manifest.xml 2013-08-22 14:32:42,805 DEBUG Walrus request header: Authorization: AWS L4836KVYWMJCXT4T6Q6B9:1mGBhKR4G+vFv6QmL8XHHAV/UoM= 2013-08-22 14:32:42,805 DEBUG Walrus request header: Content-Length: 0 2013-08-22 14:32:42,805 DEBUG Walrus request header: Date: Thu, 22 Aug 2013 21:32:42 -0000 2013-08-22 14:32:42,806 DEBUG Walrus request header: Host: 10.104.1.216:8773 2013-08-22 14:32:42,806 DEBUG Walrus request header: User-Agent: euca2ools/3.0.0 (CPython 2.6.6; Linux 2.6.32-358.6.2.el6.x86_64; x86_64) requestbuilder/0.1.0-beta2 requests/1.1.0 2013-08-22 14:32:42,861 DEBUG Walrus response time: 0.055 seconds 2013-08-22 14:32:42,861 ERROR Walrus response status: 404 2013-08-22 14:32:42,861 DEBUG Walrus response header: content-length: 326 2013-08-22 14:32:42,861 DEBUG Walrus response header: content-type: application/xml 2013-08-22 14:32:42,874 DEBUG GetObject -- response content -- NoSuchEntityThe specified entity was not foundraring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.manifest.xml10bbe9cd-35d6-4bc6-ac29-2c4f91c2155d 2013-08-22 14:32:42,875 DEBUG GetObject -- end of response content -- 2013-08-22 14:32:42,875 INFO GetObject result: failure euca-delete-bundle: error: manifest file 'raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.manifest.xml' does not exist in bucket 'imwitit'. Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/bin/euca-delete-bundle", line 6, in euca2ools.commands.bundle.deletebundle.DeleteBundle.run() File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/command.py", line 288, in run cmd.handle_cli_exception(err) File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/request.py", line 201, in handle_cli_exception BaseCommand.handle_cli_exception(self, err) File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/command.py", line 285, in run result = cmd.main() File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/euca2ools/commands/bundle/deletebundle.py", line 138, in main self._delete_by_prefix() File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/euca2ools/commands/bundle/deletebundle.py", line 105, in _delete_by_prefix bucket)) requestbuilder.exceptions.ArgumentError: manifest file 'raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.manifest.xml' does not exist in bucket 'imwitit'. {code} This is different than what happens on AWS: {code} $ ec2-delete-bundle -b same-bucket-test -p raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img --access-key xxxxxxxx --secret-key xxxxxx --clear No files to delete. Attempting to delete bucket same-bucket-test... ec2-delete-bundle complete. {code} This behavior causes empty buckets to be left on Walrus. The only way to delete the bucket is to use an S3 tool like s3cmd, s3curl, etc.
fields.summary: Behavior regarding deleting bundle using --clear against empty bucket doesn't match AWS
fields.environment:
*non-HA*

* 1 x CLC,Walrus
* 1 x CC,SC
* 1 x NC

comments.body: Steps to reproduce issue: * Bundle, Upload, Register image ** AWS {code} $ /usr/local/bin/ec2-bundle-image -i /home/hspencer/raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img -c /home/hspencer/AWS-creds/cert-xxxxxxx.pem -k /home/hspencer/AWS-creds/pk-xxxxxxx.pem -u 000000000 --kernel aki-b4aa75dd -r x86_64 $ /usr/local/bin/ec2-upload-bundle -a xxxxxxxxx -s xxxxxxxxxx -b same-bucket-test -m /tmp/raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.manifest.xml --debug --url https://s3.amazonaws.com $ ec2-register -n ubuntu-test-two same-bucket-test/raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.manifest.xml {code} ** Eucalyptus {code} $ euca-bundle-image -i raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img --kernel eki-28F338EB --ramdisk eri-51253C0A -r x86_64 $ euca-upload-bundle -b imwitit -m /var/tmp/bundle-X7bErx/raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.manifest.xml $ euca-register -n young-dolph imwitit/raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.manifest.xml {code} * Deregister image and delete the bundle (without using --clear) ** AWS {code} $ ec2-deregister ami-73b6f51a $ ec2-delete-bundle -b same-bucket-test -p raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img --access-key xxxxxxxxx --secret-key xxxxxxxxxx Deleting files: - raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.manifest.xml - raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.00 - raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.01 - raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.02 - raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.03 - raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.04 - raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.05 - raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.06 - raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.07 - Eucalyptus {code} $ euca-deregister emi-34F23AA4 IMAGE emi-34F23AA4 $ euca-deregister emi-34F23AA4 IMAGE emi-34F23AA4 $ euca-delete-bundle -b imwitit -p raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img $ {code} * Check to see if bucket is still there ** AWS {code} ./s3cmd/s3cmd ls | grep same-bucket-test 2013-08-22 21:09 s3://same-bucket-test {code} ** Eucalyptus {code} $ ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=.s3cfg-admin ls | grep imwitit 2013-08-22 21:29 s3://imwitit {code} * Run delete bundle with --clear option and check to see if bucket is removed ** AWS {code} $ ec2-delete-bundle -b same-bucket-test -p raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img --access-key xxxxxxxxx --secret-key xxxxxxxxxx --clear No files to delete. Attempting to delete bucket same-bucket-test... ec2-delete-bundle complete. $ ./s3cmd/s3cmd ls | grep same-bucket-test $ {code} ** Eucalyptus {code} $ euca-delete-bundle -b imwitit -p raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img --clear --debug 2013-08-22 14:32:42,710 DEBUG DeleteBundle parsed arguments: {'userregion': None, 'url': None, 'clear': True, 'bucket': 'imwitit', 'prefix': 'raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img', 'delete_all': False, 'key_id': None, 'manifest_path': None, 'secret_key': None} 2013-08-22 14:32:42,710 DEBUG Config searching regions for option 's3-url' 2013-08-22 14:32:42,710 DEBUG Config section 'aws:us-east-1' 2013-08-22 14:32:42,710 INFO Config option 's3-url' = 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/' 2013-08-22 14:32:42,710 DEBUG Config searching regions 'imwitit'. Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/bin/euca-delete-bundle", line 6, in euca2ools.commands.bundle.deletebundle.DeleteBundle.run() File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/command.py", line 288, in run cmd.handle_cli_exception(err) File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/request.py", line 201, in handle_cli_exception BaseCommand.handle_cli_exception(self, err) File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/command.py", line 285, in run result = cmd.main() File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/euca2ools/commands/bundle/deletebundle.py", line 138, in main self._delete_by_prefix() File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/euca2ools/commands/bundle/deletebundle.py", line 105, in _delete_by_prefix bucket)) requestbuilder.exceptions.ArgumentError: manifest file 'raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.manifest.xml' does not exist in bucket 'imwitit'. $ ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=.s3cfg-admin ls | grep imwitit 2013-08-22 21:29 s3://imwitit {code}

It sounds like the only question we have to answer here is what {{ec2-delete-bundle}} does when you tell it to delete a bundle that doesn't exist.  In the absence of the {{\--clear}} option does it fail or simply do nothing?  Does its output change based on what it finds?

Hey [~gholms],

Apologies for getting to this so late.  Currently, with euca2ools, if you run euca-delete-bundle without the --clear option, we error out:
{code}
[root@odc-d-06-07 ~]# euca-delete-bundle -b kvm-vwmare-centos5-ramdisk
usage: euca-delete-bundle -b BUCKET[/PREFIX] (-m MANIFEST | -p PREFIX)
                          [--clear] [--region USER@REGION | -U URL]
                          [-I KEY_ID] [-S KEY] [--debug] [--debugger]
                          [--version] [-h]
euca-delete-bundle: error: one of the arguments -m/--manifest -p/--prefix is required
{code}
This should be fixed by commit {{35b8f6f}}.

Comment from gholms:

--clear is still supposed to delete the bucket even if the manifest is missing.

Behavior seen on 4.0:
{code}
# euca-version
euca2ools 3.1.0-pre2-3-g72569c3 (Omega)
eucalyptus 4.0.0 - 4.0.0-0.0.867.20140411git0cd00881.el6.x86_64
{code}

{code}
[root@odc-d-31 ~]# euca-delete-bundle -b ubuntu-trusty-x86_64-20140411 -p trusty-server-cloudimg-amd64-vmlinuz-generic
>>> BundlePart('trusty-server-cloudimg-amd64-vmlinuz-generic.part.00', '0726c76d21c4ce7eeefbcd92288f8f3fd92d88c6', 'SHA1', None) ubuntu-trusty-x86_64-20140411/trusty-server-cloudimg-amd64-vmlinuz-generic.part.00
>>> manifest ubuntu-trusty-x86_64-20140411/trusty-server-cloudimg-amd64-vmlinuz-generic.manifest.xml
[root@odc-d-31 ~]# ls /bukkits/
2584595f-ebbc-4c5d-b8b6-0a1fc367e17f  4eb23bb2-2d68-4588-adae-e5df4303833d  f03194ba-4777-4c10-8631-d263fdf64979  lost+found
2a2bbfae-f26a-459f-9ddc-13eebc45da35  64a57bd3-25dc-4363-937d-b955ac8cc8d4  fe6be133-1e77-4c4d-b3d5-70b5edcd5f95
[root@odc-d-31 ~]# euca-delete-bundle -b ubuntu-trusty-x86_64-20140411 -p trusty-server-cloudimg-amd64-vmlinuz-generic --clear
euca-delete-bundle: error: manifest 'ubuntu-trusty-x86_64-20140411/trusty-server-cloudimg-amd64-vmlinuz-generic.manifest.xml' does not exist on the server
[root@odc-d-31 ~]# ls /bukkits/
2584595f-ebbc-4c5d-b8b6-0a1fc367e17f  4eb23bb2-2d68-4588-adae-e5df4303833d  f03194ba-4777-4c10-8631-d263fdf64979  lost+found
2a2bbfae-f26a-459f-9ddc-13eebc45da35  64a57bd3-25dc-4363-937d-b955ac8cc8d4  fe6be133-1e77-4c4d-b3d5-70b5edcd5f95
{code}
I fixed this in commit {{b792b83}}, though note that if it cannot delete the bucket it will still complain about the lack of a manifest.

Worked as expected with {{--clear}} argument. Deleted the hvm image with the bucket.

Installed Packages:
{noformat}
Name        : euca2ools
Arch        : noarch
Version     : 3.1.0
Release     : 0.0.171.20140418git84a78251.el6
{noformat}

From Euca2ools standpoint, looks like it's working. Bucket gets deleted when using {{--clear}} option.

EUCA-9184 is opened to track the issue "buckets not getting removed from bukkits/ directory".

[~hspencer], please reopen if you see this euca2ools issue again.
